name: portafer production | portafer | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/918/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of portafer (ferric oxide) from iron ore in the ground. Portafer is a brand name for ferric oxide and is used mainly for the production of construction materials (50%) and coatings (28%). It is used to produce brown glass, as well as brown, black, green, red or yellow colors in glazes or enamels. Ferric oxide (Fe2O3) – also called red iron oxide – is one of the three different forms of iron oxides which exist and that are used in iron production. ;Since no quantitative information was found concerning the production of ferric oxides, it is assumed for this dataset that ferric oxide – like for iron-containing minerals in general – is extracted by open pits mining, followed by crushing and milling of the mined ores. Land-use is approximated based on iron ore extraction. Material and energy inputs, industrial machines, and particulate emissions are approximated based on iron mining and limestone crushing and milling.;References:;Hischier R. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Packagings and Graphical Papers. Ecoinvent report No. 11, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.

From the extraction of iron ore in ground.

This activity ends with the production of 1 kg of portafer. The dataset includes raw materials, machineries and energy consumption for production, emissions to air, and infrastructure. The dataset doesn't include water emissions, overburden and tailing material from processing, and losses of product.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/071:Mining of iron ores/0710:Mining of iron ores

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data are used here as European average.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: As a first approximation, the technology is based on iron mining, limestone crushing and limestone milling technologies. The overall yield is assumed to be 90%. The dataset represents a rough average of the aforementioned technologies.;Reference: ;Hischier R. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Packagings and Graphical Papers. Ecoinvent report No. 11, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The processes described in this dataset are approximated with data from other similar activities:
- Mining: as an approximation of the environmental burden due to the mining activities, the dataset for iron mining (see Classen et al. (2007)) is used. Therefore, all information is copied directly from the iron mining dataset.
- Crushing: data for crushing are copied from the dataset that represents the crushing of limestone (see Kellenberger et al. (2007)).
- Milling: data for milling are also copied from the equivalent step within the limestone production chain.

References:
Hischier R. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Packagings and Graphical Papers. Ecoinvent report No. 11, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.
Classen M., Althaus H.-J., Blaser S., Doka G., Jungbluth N. and Tuchschmid M. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Metals. Final report ecoinvent data v2.0 No.10. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
Kellenberger D., Althaus H.-J., Jungbluth N. and Künniger T. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Building Products. Final report ecoinvent data v2.0 No. 7. Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Empa - TSL, Dübendorf, CH.

exchanges.description: Portafer is a brand name for ferric oxide and is used for the production of brown glass. Besides it is used for brown, black, green, red or yellow colors in glazes or enamels. Ferric oxide also called red iron oxide - is one of the three different forms of iron oxides which exist and that are used in the iron production. Most important uses of Portafer are construction materials and coatings.
